pages.text: $(#551012)Cycle 4, Entry 2 $(br2)The bone-white fingers of memory still point true - these silent sentinels with their luminous veins remain the Realm's last honest geometry. Their basalt flesh remembers the weight of my first footsteps, their glowstone blood still charts

$(#551012)constellations from better aeons. I trace the glyphs in their bark, these living archives of a time when the air thrummed with verdant chorus rather than ash-laden dirges. The Gloworms' bioluminescent shiver beneath the leaves mirrors my own fractured recollections - bright shards struggling against the hungry dark. Their cold fire licks my palms, each wriggling spark a morsel that nourishes both body and brittle hope.

$(#551012)How cruel that these arboreal ghosts persist when all else crumbles. Their roots clutch at dirt like arthritic scholars gripping crumbling scrolls, preserving fragments of the lush tapestry that once draped these wastes. Even now they offer up their bones for my tools, their sacrifice more generous than any pilgrim's empty vows.

$(#551012)I'll carve my repentance from their radiant flesh, fashioning implements from this last echo of creation's grace. Let the worms' light guide me through memory's labyrinth - their flickering dance the only map I dare trust in this eroding world.$(br2)â€”Elara
